instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Hello friends, I get a Macbook Air 820-3437-B with liquid damage in the sectors
U4650
U5000
U7501

Only with the charger connected the light goes from green to orange and does nothing

I did a thorough check and changed all the damaged components and reballing the U5000
Also reviewing in other posts I saw that they made some measurements in the U7100 so to advance something I did these measurements

u7100

Pin 1 0V
Pin 2 14.6V
Pin 3 3.8V
Pin 9 0.037V
Pin 12 3.4V
Pin 13 3.37V
Pin 14 3.37V
Pin 15 0V
Pin 17 4.04V
Pin 19 5.05V
Pin 20 5.03V
Pin 27 14.4V

PP5V_S4RS3 Isn´t present

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Start posting diode mode reading at PPBUS_G3H (red probe at ground).
Check the resistance value between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7100.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Thanks for the welcome, I am very excited as I have experience repairing iPhone and I am just entering the world of Mac

PPBUS_g3h 0.122

Resistance between Pins 17/18 =  3.2 ohm
Resistance between Pins 27/28 = 20 ohm

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
I'm not sure about the values; diode mode readings?
We need ohm scale measurments; should get very low values, as per schematic.
Check R7121/22 and R7151/52 with their traces.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
sorry, I edited the answer with correct information
 
Diode mode PPBUS_g3h = 0.122V

Resistance between Pins 17/18 = 3.2 ohm
Resistance between Pins 27/28 = 20 ohm 

R7121 = 10 ohm
R7122 = 10.3 ohm

R7151 = 2.5 ohm
R7152 = 0.2 ohm

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
No need to check the resistors, if the asked values are good.

Remove F7140 and check C7140 voltage.
Be sure R7113 is good, as its traces too.
Check all components and traces related with pins 5, 7, 8.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
with F7140 removed 
C7140 = 8.56 V

R7113 is good 

All components and traces related to pins 5, 7 and 8 are good.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
So you have a problem on the PPBUS_G3H, after F7140.
Resolder F7140 and check voltage on its pin 2.
If still low, check diode mode to ground on all big coils, apart of L7130.
See if any gives the same value as in PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Thank you for your answer but i am a little confused, in Rossmann Repair Training Guide it says 

[LIST]
[*]On Macbook Airs and old Macbook Pro 17” PPBUS_G3H is 8.5v when 
[*]the SMC is able to communicate with the ISL, 8.16v when the SMC 
[*]cannot. 
[/LIST]

[LIST]
[*]On Macbook Pros PPBUS_G3H is 12.56v when the SMC is able to communicate with the ISL, 12.23v when the SMC cannot.
[/LIST]

taking this into account the voltage of PPBUS_G3H in the model I'm looking at would be fine

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Your problem is not caused by communication between SMC and ISL6259.

You've said to have 4V at PPBUS_G3H, when F7140 is in place.
Confirm if is true...

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message: i have 8.57 V in PPBUS_G3H with F7140 in place.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
"Pin 17 4.04V"
We need accurate and consistent information, in order to help you.

Do you now get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
PP3v3_SUS  present
PP3v3_S5 present

I don´t know if its normal but the line P3v3_S5_Comp2 have  2.2V

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Post SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_RSMRST_L and SMC_ONOFF_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L (using R5115/16 pads, instead of power button) and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN    3.3V
PM_PWRBTN_L   3.4V
PM_RSMRST_L    0V
SMC_ONOFF_L  3.4V

Drop pulse  3.4V to 0.352V when  SMC_ONOFF_L isTrigger

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message: Post U8130 voltages.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Pin 1 3.3V
Pin 2 3.3V
Pin 3 0.361V
Pin 4 3.2V
Pin 6 0V

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Check R8133.
If good, change U8130.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
R8133 it´s ok
i changed u8130 and now it gives me these values
PIN 1 3.3V
PIN 2 3.3V
PIN 3 1.4V
PIN 4 3.2V
PIN 6 3.2V

still does not turn on

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message: Now trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L (at same time).

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S4_L is unstable, shows voltage variations from 0 to 0.125V without trigger SMC_ONOFF_L
if trigger SMC_ONOFF_L makes no difference and keeps oscillating

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message: PM_SLP_S4_L has 0V and does nothing when SMC_ONOFF_L is activated

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message: PM_SLP_S4_L has 0 V and does nothing when SMC_ONOFF_L is activated

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Then the problem is PCH related.
I suppose PM_RSMRST_L is steady high and you still note the drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

Check PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PM_BATLOW_L, 1V05_SUS and the 4 PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
effectively when I activate SMC_ONOFF_L the pulse is seen in PM_PWRBTN_L but not in PM_RSMRST_L

PCH_DSWVRMEN 3.3V
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.4V
PM_BATLOW_L 3.3V
1V05_SUS 1.05V

how are they measured of the 4 PCH's RTC signals?

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Read this thread:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
RTC_RESET_L 3.3V
PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.3V
PCH_INTRUDER_L 3.0V
PCH_INTVRMEN 3.0V

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
Heat PCH for test; use quality flux, to burn eventually accumulated crap underneath.
Don't need to melt the balls; no more than 180-200 degrees, for 15-20s.

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
now it works :D
What do you recommend me to do now? 
Can I deliver it to the client with confidence or will it be better to reball?

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
now it's working :D
What do you recommend me to do now?

threads.title: 820-3437-B with liquid damage
threads.message:
If was question of accumulated crap, you are lucky; should last.
Anyway, pray for it...
